title.value: Behavioural equivalences for continuous-time Markov processes
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as stated in the document.
title.quote: Behavioural equivalences for continuous-time Markov processes

extractions.description: This paper generalizes the concept of bisimulation from discrete-time to continuous-time by providing a notion of behavioural equivalence for continuous-time Markov processes. It unifies previous conference presentations and gives detailed proofs of the concepts introduced.

type.justification: The paper focuses on theoretical aspects of bisimulation in continuous-time Markov processes and provides mathematical proofs.
type.quote: The core of this work is to generalise the discrete-time picture to continuous time by providing a notion of behavioural equivalence for continuous-time Markov processes.... The present work unifies the cited conference presentations and gives detailed proofs.

name.justification: The primary field is a theoretical study within the domain of computer science, dealing with mathematical structures and principles.
The study specifically extends bisimulation to continuous-time Markov processes.
name.quote: The core of this work is to generalise the discrete-time picture to continuous time by providing a notion of behavioural equivalence for continuous-time Markov processes.

name.justification: The paper introduces and compares different notions of bisimulation in continuous time.
name.quote: In Chen et al. (2019), we introduced two equivalent definitions of bisimulation for continuous-time stochastic processes.
